title: Stubble burning – The Issue and Mitigations
content: Stubble burning – the burning of crop residue by farmers to clear their fields for winter sowing, metamorphosizes into a crisis when the air in and around of Delhi – NCR (National Capital Region) turns into a dark cesspool of toxic pollutants. In this regard, GCRF-CEPHA welcoming you to join the panel discussion with leading experts to listen to their thoughts on “Stubble burning – The Issue and Mitigations” is scheduled at 03.30 pm (Indian Standard Time) on 20th November 2020.

title: Crop Residue Field Burning and Effects on Air Quality
content: GCRF-CEPHA is welcoming you to join the air quality monthly lecture #02 on “Crop Residue Field Burning and Effects on Air Quality” by Prof. Nguyen Thi Kim Oanh, Asian Institute of Technology is scheduled at 02.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 20th November 2020.

title: Challenges and Strategy for Abating PM 2.5 Pollution
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the air quality monthly lecture #03 on “Challenges and Strategy for Abating PM 2.5 Pollution: A Case Study of National Capital Territory of Delhi” by Prof. Mukesh Sharma, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur scheduled at 02.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 18th December 2020.

title: Air Quality Management in India-Way Ahead
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the air quality monthly lecture #04 on “Air Quality Management in India-Way Ahead” by Prof. Mukesh Khare, Indian Institute of Technology Delhi scheduled at 02.30 pm (Indian standard time) on 22nd January 2021.

title: Modelling and Managing Air Quality using Data from Intelligent Transport System Technologies
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the air quality monthly lecture #05 on “Modelling and Managing Air Quality using Data from Intelligent Transport System Technologies” by Professor Margaret C. Bell, CBE, Science City Professor of Transport and Environment, Newcastle University scheduled at 03.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 25th February 2021.

title: A citizen centred approach for air quality management: a case study from the United Kingdom and Europe
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the air quality monthly lecture #06 on “A citizen centred approach for air quality management: a case study from the United Kingdom and Europe” by Prof. Enda Hayes, a professor of Air Quality and Carbon Management, University of the West of England, United Kingdom. The meeting is scheduled at 03.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 19th March 2021.

title: COVID-19 pandemic lessons for air quality management
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the air quality management lecture #07 on “COVID-19 pandemic lessons for air quality management” by Dr. Sotiris Vardoulakis, Professor of Global Environmental Health, The Australian National University. The meeting is scheduled at 03.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 23rd April 2021.

title: Indoor Air Quality Audit in Buildings – System Zone Concept
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the air quality management lecture #08 on “Indoor Air Quality Audit in Buildings – System Zone Concept” by Professor Chandra Sekhar, Prog Director, MSc (Building Performance and Sustainability), Department of Building, School of Design and Environment, National University of Singapore. The meeting is scheduled at 03.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 21st May 2021.

title: Analyzing ambient air quality data for better decision making and communication
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #09 on “How do you communicate Ambient Air Quality? Challenges and Innovations” by Dr. Prasad Modak, Executive President, Environmental Management Centre LLP & Director, Ekonnect Knowledge Foundation. The lecture is scheduled at 03.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 18th June 2021.

title: System approach for air quality problem in Thailand: a case study of haze episode
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #10 on “System approach for air quality problem in Thailand: a case study of haze episode” by Prof. Kraichat Tantrakarnapa, Department of Social and Environmental Medicine, Faculty of Tropical Medicine, Mahidol University, Thailand. The lecture is scheduled at 02.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 16th July 2021.

title: ISSUES AND CHALLENGES IN AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT IN INDIA
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #11 on “Issues and Challenges in Air Quality Management in India” by Shri S. K. Gupta, M/s Envirotech Instruments Pvt. Ltd., New Delhi. The lecture is scheduled at 03.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 20th August 2021.

title: Individual-worn sensors assessing personal environmental exposure
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #12 on “Individual-worn sensors assessing personal environmental exposure” by Prof. Dr. Uwe Schlink, Helmholtz Centre for Environmental Research -UFZ, Leipzig, Germany. The lecture is scheduled at 04.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 17th September 2021.

title: Air Quality Management for better health: Looking beyond model based forecasting
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #13 on “Air Quality Management for better health: Looking beyond model based forecasting” by Prof. Arun Kr. Sharma, MD, MBA, Director, ICMR-National Institute for Implementation Research on Non-communicable Diseases, Jodhpur, Rajasthan. The lecture is scheduled at 03.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 22nd October 2021.

title: Are we doing enough in technology space for air pollution control?
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #14 on “Are we doing enough in technology space for air pollution control?” by Dr. Rakesh Kumar, Former Director, CSIR NEERI, Nagpur, Maharashtra. The lecture is scheduled at 03.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 26th November 2021.

title: ROLE OF SAFAR IN AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #15 on “ROLE OF SAFAR IN AIR QUALITY MANAGEMENT” by Prof. (Dr.) Gufran Beig, FASc., Founder, Project Director, SAFAR, Sir Ashutosh Mukherjee Chair Professor, NIAS, IISc Campus, BANGALORE. title: Air Quality from Essentials of Environmental Health

The lecture is scheduled at 06.30 pm (Indian standard time) on 21st January 2022.

title: A 360° view of air pollution and CVD in India
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #17 on “A 360° view of air pollution and CVD in India” by Prof. Prabhakaran Dorairaj, Vice President (Research and Policy) and Executive Director, Centre for Chronic Disease Control, PHFI, India. The lecture is scheduled at 03.00 pm (Indian standard time) on 18th February 2022.

title: Developing Models for Air Quality Management
content: CEPHA Network is welcoming you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #18 on “Developing Models for Air Quality Management” by Prof. AKULA VENKATRAM, University of California, Riverside. The lecture is scheduled at 09.30 am (Indian standard time) on 18th March 2022.

title: Modeling of Emerging and Unconventional Sources of Pollution from an Air Quality Management Perspective
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #19 on “Modeling of Emerging and Unconventional Sources of Pollution from an Air Quality Management Perspective” by Prof. Kuruvilla John, Department of Mechanical Engineering, University of North Texas, USA. title: Advanced Air Quality Monitoring Technologies and Capacity Building under India’s Clean Air Program
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #20 on “Advanced Air Quality Monitoring Technologies and Capacity Building under India’s Clean Air Program” by Dr. S. N. Tripathi, FNA, FNAE, FNASc, Arjun Dev Joneja Chair Professor, J. C. Bose National Fellow, Department of Civil Engineering, Centre for Environmental Science and Engineering, Kesvan Centre for Energy Policy and Climate Solutions, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur. title: Urban Air Quality Management – Challenges
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #21 on “Urban Air Quality Management – Challenges” by Dr. Srinivasalu IFS, Member Secretary, Karnataka State Pollution Control Board (KSPCB), Government of Karnataka. title: Catalyzing air quality actions to address the health burden from ambient and household air pollution: Experience from field studies in India
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #22 on “Catalyzing air quality actions to address the health burden from ambient and household air pollution: Experience from field studies in India” by Prof. Kalpana Balakrishnan, Dean (Research) and Director, World Health Organization Collaborating Center for Occupational and Environmental Health ICMR Center for Advanced Research on Air Quality, Climate and Health, Sri Ramachandra Institute for Higher Education and Research, Chennai, India. title: Air quality modeling: An effective tool for managing urban air pollution
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #24 on “Air quality modeling: An effective tool for managing urban air pollution” by Dr. Prateek Sharma, Vice Chancellor (acting) & Professor, Department of Sustainable Engineering at TERI School of Advanced Studies, New Delhi, India. The lecture is scheduled on 23rd September 2022 (Friday) at 15:00 – 16:30 (Indian Standard Time).

title: Recent Experiences with Air Pollution Studies of Cities in India
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #25 on “Recent Experiences with Air Pollution Studies of Cities in India” by Dr. Virendra Sethi, Professor, Environmental Science and Engineering Department (previously CESE) at IIT Bombay, India. title: Mitigating the effects of air pollutants on people and buildings

title: Air Quality Management- Policy and Governance: India context

title: Air Pollution Trends in India – Disentangling the Role of Meteorology and Changing Emissions

Mauzerall, Professor, Environmental Engineering and International Affairs, Princeton School of Public and International Affairs and the Department of Civil and Environmental Engineering, Princeton University, Princeton, NJ USA. The lecture is scheduled on 20th January 2023 (Friday) at 19:00 – 20:30 (Indian Standard Time).

title: Ventilation strategies for reduction of airborne transmission in indoor environment

title: Exploring Personal Exposure to Airborne Contaminants Using Wearable Passive Samplers

title: Developing action on Short-Lived Climate Pollutants with the Climate and Clean Air Coalition and assessing the cost of inaction on air pollutants and SLCPs
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #32 on “Developing action on Short-Lived Climate Pollutants with the Climate and Clean Air Coalition and assessing the cost of inaction on air pollutants and SLCPs” by Dr. Johan C.I. title: Increases in Ambient Air Pollution in Singapore during the Hungry Ghost Festival and other Events Involving Burning

Webster, Division of Chemistry & Biological Chemistry, School of Chemistry, Chemical Engineering and Biotechnology, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore. The lecture is scheduled on 16th  June 2023 (Friday) at 11:30 – 13:00 (Indian Standard Time).

title: Air Quality Management; Where are we today?
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #34 on “Air Quality Management; Where are we today?” by Mr. Prashant Kokil, Environmental Professional, Former Head, Corporate Environment and Climate Change, Former CSO, The TATA Power Company Ltd., India. The lecture is scheduled on 21st  July 2023 (Friday) at 15:00 – 16:30 (Indian Standard Time).

title: The abundance, allergenic effects and public health burden of airborne pollen in Australia

title: Assessment of air pollution, induced stress, tolerance, and accumulated PM on the selected indigenous plant species in Delhi NCR

Nema, Professor and Head, Department of Civil Engineering, Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi, New Delhi, India. The lecture is scheduled on 22nd  September 2023 (Friday) at 02:00 – 03:30 pm (Indian Standard Time).

title: Freight and Environment – Challenges, Policies and Opportunities in India
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #37 on “Freight and Environment – Challenges, Policies and Opportunities in India” by Mr. Parthaa Bosu, Executive Director at EPIC India. title: Air Quality Management in the UK – Challenges and New Developments
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #38 on “Air Quality Management in the UK – Challenges and New Developments” by Prof. Anil Namdeo, Professor of Air Quality Management and Net Zero in the Department of Geography and Environmental Sciences, Northumbria University, Newcastle, UK. title: Urban Air Pollution and Health Effects: An Overview of the Recent Canadian Wildfire Episode in New York City

title: Exposure to urban air pollution in India and children’s lungs: The APEAL study
content: CEPHA Network is inviting you to join the Air Quality Management Lecture #43 on “Exposure to urban air pollution in India and children’s lungs: The APEAL study” by Dr. Harish C. The lecture is scheduled for 21st June 2024 (Friday) at 09:00 – 10:00 (Indian Standard Time).
